title: Can you solve the rogue submarine riddle? Difficulty level: Master - Alex Rosenthal

options.label: D

title: You could have a secret twin (but not the way you think) - Kayla Mandel Sheets

multiple-choice.question: What is the condition where an individual has two genomes present in the tissues of their body?

options.label: A
options.text: Mosaicism

options.label: B
options.text: Chimerism

options.label: C
options.text: Genetic mutation

options.label: D
options.text: Twin syndrome

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, how does chimerism occur in a mother and fetus?

options.label: A
options.text: Through a tissue or organ transplant

options.label: B
options.text: When a mother and fetus swap cells in the flow of nutrients across the placenta

options.label: C
options.text: When a mother's immune system is suppressed during pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: When a fetus is born with a genetic mutation

multiple-choice.question: If a person has chimerism, what might be visible signs of the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Two-toned skin or hair, or two different colored eyes

options.label: B
options.text: No visible signs of the condition

options.label: C
options.text: A genetic mutation

options.label: D
options.text: A birth defect

multiple-choice.question: A mother's liver started to regenerate itself after years of failing. What was found in the regenerated tissue?

options.label: A
options.text: DNA from a previous pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: DNA from a twin

options.label: C
options.text: DNA from a tissue or organ transplant

options.label: D
options.text: DNA from a genetic mutation

multiple-choice.question: If a person has chimerism, how can it affect their children?

options.label: A
options.text: Only if they inherit the second genome

options.label: B
options.text: Only if they inherit the first genome

options.label: C
options.text: It can affect their children in unpredictable ways

options.label: D
options.text: It has no effect on their children

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the condition where an individual has two genomes present in the tissues of their body, and how does it relate to Greek mythology?

options.label: A
options.text: Chimerism, named after the Chimera, a three-headed monster

options.label: B
options.text: Chimerism, named after the Chimera, an amalgam of three different animals

options.label: C
options.text: Mosaicism, named after the Mosaic, a work of art

options.label: D
options.text: Genetic mutation, named after the Mutant, a superhero

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of a father's sperm can carry a second genome from an embryonic twin?
According to the transcript, how many people are believed to have chimerism from an embryonic twin?

options.label: A
options.text: Few

options.label: B
options.text: Many

options.label: C
options.text: None

options.label: D
options.text: Unknown

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the fact that 1 in 8 individual births started out as twin pregnancies?

options.label: A
options.text: It means that many people have chimerism

options.label: B
options.text: It means that many people have genetic mutations

options.label: C
options.text: It means that many people have a higher risk of birth defects

options.label: D
options.text: It means that many people have a lower risk of genetic disorders

multiple-choice.question: What can be learned from the fact that people are all amalgams to some extent, carrying around the different genetic codes of their gut bacteria and even their mitochondria?

options.label: A
options.text: That genetics is a simple and straightforward field

options.label: B
options.text: That genetics is a complex and multifaceted field

options.label: C
options.text: That genetics is not relevant to human health

options.label: D
options.text: That genetics is not important for understanding human behavior

title: Earth's mysterious red glow, explained - Zoe Pierrat

options.label: A
options.text: A wavelength that corresponds with densely populated areas

options.label: B
options.text: A wavelength that never escapes the Sun's outer atmosphere

options.label: C
options.text: A wavelength that is reflected sunlight

options.label: D
options.text: A wavelength that is emitted by human-made sources

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: How can chlorophyll fluorescence be used to monitor the health of ecosystems worldwide?

options.label: A
options.text: By tracking levels of greenness in plants

options.label: B
options.text: By monitoring the amount of oxygen released by plants

options.label: C
options.text: By tracking the amount of carbon absorbed by plants

options.label: D
options.text: By observing the red glow of the Earth from space

multiple-choice.question: What is the advantage of using chlorophyll fluorescence as a measure of plant health compared to tracking levels of greenness?

options.label: A
options.text: It is more expensive

options.label: B
options.text: It is less reliable

options.label: C
options.text: It can detect drops in chlorophyll fluorescence may occur before visible signs of plant stress

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: By monitoring the amount of carbon absorbed by phytoplankton

options.label: C
options.text: By observing the red glow of the water from space

options.label: D
options.text: By tracking the changes in chlorophyll fluorescence levels

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential benefit of investigating photosynthesis from space?

options.label: A
options.text: It will help us understand the causes of climate change

options.label: B
options.text: It will allow us to track the health of ecosystems worldwide

options.label: C
options.text: It will enable us to support our silent friends who already do so much for us

options.label: D
options.text: It will help us develop new technologies for space exploration

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between photosynthesis and the health of ecosystems worldwide?

options.label: A
options.text: Photosynthesis is the cause of ecosystem health

options.label: B
options.text: Photosynthesis is the effect of ecosystem health

options.label: C
options.text: Photosynthesis is a direct measure of ecosystem health

options.label: D
options.text: Photosynthesis is a indirect measure of ecosystem health

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the discovery of chlorophyll fluorescence in the context of understanding the health of ecosystems worldwide?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a minor discovery that has no significant impact

options.label: B
options.text: It is a major breakthrough that has revolutionized our understanding of ecosystem health
